timeline.message:
Runtime compressed refs work

Remove assumptions about the size of f9object_t/fomrobject_t.

[ci skip]

Signed-off-by: Graham Chapman <graham_chapman@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Should operations with (endPtr - scanPtr) be changed as well? This is pointer math related to size of fomrobject_t *
timeline.author: dmitripivkine
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,7 +58,7 @@ class GC_PointerArrayObjectScanner : public GC_IndexableObjectScanner
 	 * @param[in] flags Scanning context flags
 	 */
 	MMINLINE GC_PointerArrayObjectScanner(MM_EnvironmentBase *env, omrobjectptr_t arrayPtr, fomrobject_t *basePtr, fomrobject_t *limitPtr, fomrobject_t *scanPtr, fomrobject_t *endPtr, uintptr_t flags)
-		: GC_IndexableObjectScanner(env, arrayPtr, basePtr, limitPtr, scanPtr, endPtr, ((endPtr - scanPtr) < _bitsPerScanMap) ? (((uintptr_t)1 << (endPtr - scanPtr)) - 1) : UDATA_MAX, sizeof(fomrobject_t), flags)
+		: GC_IndexableObjectScanner(env, arrayPtr, basePtr, limitPtr, scanPtr, endPtr, ((endPtr - scanPtr) < _bitsPerScanMap) ? (((uintptr_t)1 << (endPtr - scanPtr)) - 1) : UDATA_MAX, env->compressObjectReferences() ? sizeof(uint32_t) : sizeof(uintptr_t), flags)

replies.bodyText: That looks like a good candidate for what's causing my issue - will fix.
replies.author: gacholio

timeline.bodyText: This change is correct but would it be cleaner just do ((uintptr_t)_endPtr - (uintptr_t)_scanPtr) ?
timeline.author: dmitripivkine

replies.bodyText: Obviously current implementation returns value aligned to _elementSize and suggested does not necessarily. I am not sure do we use this fact anywhere (pass unaligned addresses). So would be safer to keep current implementation
replies.author: dmitripivkine

replies.bodyText: I'm still tempted to do the fast thing here (I did it elsewhere already). If the pointers aren't aligned to _elementSize, then the pointer math is going to be undefined anyway.
replies.author: gacholio

timeline.message: Signed-off-by: Graham Chapman <graham_chapman@ca.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Graham Chapman <graham_chapman@ca.ibm.com>

compressed by default

Signed-off-by: Graham Chapman <graham_chapman@ca.ibm.com>

compressed by default

Signed-off-by: Graham Chapman <graham_chapman@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: We could have a non-static variant of this method and call for each iteration slotObject.addToSlotAddress(1, compressed);  while constructing slotObject only once before entering the loop. It would be slightly more readable to me, but I'm not pushing for it.
timeline.author: amicic

timeline.bodyText: hm... convertPointerFromToken itself has already a runtime 'if CR' check.
timeline.author: amicic

timeline.bodyText: For better readablily, I'd store '(UDATA)lhsObject + startOffset + offset' into a local like lhsAddress.
timeline.author: amicic

timeline.bodyText: We have up to 3 'if CR' runtime checks, while it's probably doable with only one :(
timeline.author: amicic

replies.author: amicic

timeline.bodyText: this pattern repeats often. we should just have something like env->getObjectReferenceSize()
timeline.author: amicic

timeline.bodyText: This pass is somewhat perf critical and extra runtime checks in readReferenceFromSlot() could be tangible (sparsly populated arrays). Would it make sense to have specialized GC_SlotObject::readCRReferenceFromSlot/readNonCRReferenceFromSlot APIs?
timeline.author: amicic

timeline.bodyText:
This itself is good, but similarly to slow barrier code, this is invoked from a site where there is already a runtime CR check (see readObjectImpl).
As mentioned before, we could specialize this method further into two methods for CR and nonCR, and use proper one from the call site that already knows if it's CR or not.
We could keep this one too, for sites where we don't know if it's CR.
timeline.author: amicic

timeline.bodyText: as proposed before we could use a non-static addToSlotAddress
timeline.author: amicic

timeline.bodyText: This line is too long now... Can it be split somehow to be more read friendly?
timeline.author: dmitripivkine
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,7 +58,7 @@ class GC_PointerArrayObjectScanner : public GC_IndexableObjectScanner
 	 * @param[in] flags Scanning context flags
 	 */
 	MMINLINE GC_PointerArrayObjectScanner(MM_EnvironmentBase *env, omrobjectptr_t arrayPtr, fomrobject_t *basePtr, fomrobject_t *limitPtr, fomrobject_t *scanPtr, fomrobject_t *endPtr, uintptr_t flags)
-		: GC_IndexableObjectScanner(env, arrayPtr, basePtr, limitPtr, scanPtr, endPtr, ((endPtr - scanPtr) < _bitsPerScanMap) ? (((uintptr_t)1 << (endPtr - scanPtr)) - 1) : UDATA_MAX, sizeof(fomrobject_t), flags)
+		: GC_IndexableObjectScanner(env, arrayPtr, basePtr, limitPtr, scanPtr, endPtr, (GC_SlotObject::subtractSlotAddresses(endPtr, scanPtr, env->compressObjectReferences()) < _bitsPerScanMap) ? ((uintptr_t)1 << GC_SlotObject::subtractSlotAddresses(endPtr, scanPtr, env->compressObjectReferences())) - 1 : UDATA_MAX, env->compressObjectReferences() ? sizeof(uint32_t) : sizeof(uintptr_t), flags)
